text.text_translated:
Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we saw early human civilisation.
For example, we saw drawings on rock.
No one knows the link to language.
Brains did not suddenly get bigger.
A brain is the part in the head that thinks.
But people became more intelligent.
They did more kinds of things.
Did using language make their brains develop?
Or did better brains start to make language?

best_attempt.text_translated:
We saw early human civilisation between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago.
For example, we saw cave paintings.
No one knows the connection with language.
Brains did not suddenly get bigger.
But humans became more complex and more intelligent.
Did using language make their brains develop?
Or did more complex brains start to produce language?
